programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Full Measure with Sharyl Attkisson

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: OJ Simpson is back in a courtroom facing charges, the jury must decide if the case is legitimate.

programme.title: Burn Pile Murder Trial
programme.desc: The Defense wanted to convince the jury that the prosecution and investigators did not do a thorough enough job in this case. Melody Farris' attorney wrapped up their closing arguments with a demonstration for jurors.

programme.title: Burn Pile Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors used their rebuttal argument to go back to their timeline of events that they claim led up to Gary Farris' death . Prosecutor Meaghan Frankish told the jury that the victim did not deserve what happened to him.

programme.title: Burn Pile Murder Trial
programme.desc: After deliberating more than 15 hours in a span of three days, the jury reached a verdict in Melody Farris's role in the shooting death of her husband, Gary. This came after they sent several notes to the judge for clarification.

programme.title: Burn Pile Murder Trial
programme.desc: Judge David Cannon. Jr. listened to the Defense and the State ahead of his sentencing. Melody Farris' legal team asked for leniency in her punishment for the murder of her husband, Gary. But the State asked for the maximum.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: The cross-examination of the DNA analyst on the stand was wide-ranging. Gary Sims was a criminalist working for the state of California. O.J. Simpson's defense team raised questions about the accreditation of him and the lab where he worked.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: Both sides went after each other in an extensive hearing. The Defense pushed back on the State's DNA exhibits claiming inaccuracy. The State then came back by accusing O.J.'s team of sandbagging them once again.
